request.description: Registers a new user (regular, specialist, or admin). Expects email, password, and user_type. Sends OTP for email verification.
Authenticates an existing user with email/password and returns a JWT token. Requires email verification + demographics completion depending on flow.
Verifies the OTP sent to the user’s email during signup and returns a JWT token once verification succeeds.
Triggers password reset flow. Sends a fresh OTP/reset code to the specified email if it exists.
Allows an authenticated user to set a new password by passing JWT in Authorization header.

header.description: JWT token from login or email-verify

request.description: Stores onboarding/demographic information for a user after signup. Must be called once per user to unlock the rest of the app.

body.raw:
{
    "user_id": "user_id_here",
    "demographics": {
        "age_range": "18-25",
        "gender_identity": "Male",
        "country_of_residence": "Karachi, Pakistan",
        "relationship_status": "Single",
        "what_brings_you_here": ["Anxiety or stress", "Depression or low mood"],
        "goals_for_using_app": ["Reduce stress/anxiety", "Improve mood & motivation"],
        "mental_health_diagnosis": "No",
        "seeing_professional": "No",
        "suicidal_thoughts": "Never",
        "exercise_frequency": "Weekly",
        "substance_use": "Never",
        "support_system": "Yes",
        "preferred_support_type": ["Self-help tools", "Chat with professional"],
        "preferred_therapist_gender": "No preference",
        "preferred_language": "English",
        "understands_emergency_disclaimer": true
    }
}

request.description: Preferred mobile sync endpoint. Accepts an array of daily entries (steps, calories, distance) and upserts aggregated values per day.
Creates or upserts a single day’s steps record. Useful for manual entry/edit from the client.
Returns the authenticated user’s steps entry for today (server date). 404 if no data exists.
Returns steps summary for a given YYYY-MM-DD date. Includes goal progress, calories, distance.
Paginated daily history ordered by date desc. Supports limit/page to power history screens.
Aggregates steps by ISO weeks (Sun-Sat) to power weekly charts.
Aggregates steps per calendar month for trend charts.
Updates a specific steps entry by ID (steps, calories, distance). Requires Authorization header.
Deletes a steps entry by ID. Returns success flag.
Calculates aggregated stats (totals, averages, streaks) for the last N days (default 30). Drives insights cards.
Returns the user’s current step streak and longest streak metrics.
Specialist-only endpoint. Creates profile with basic info, categories, experience, education, certifications. Must be called once after signup.
Returns the authenticated specialist’s own profile. Requires Authorization header.
Allows a specialist to update basic info, categories, education, and certifications.
Public listing endpoint used by the specialist search screen. Supports filters (verified, location, specialization, category, search, min_rating, min_experience) and pagination.
Returns top-rated specialists for quick display on the home screen. Can be limited and optionally filtered by location.
Provides auto-complete suggestions (names, specializations, categories) based on the search term typed by the user.
Fetches the public profile of a specialist by profile ID. Does not require authentication and is used for detail view before booking.
Upserts the user’s mood for today. Accepts optional journal entry and backend will store one record per day.
Use when syncing historical moods. Provide date + mood + optional journal text.
Fetches today’s mood entry for the authenticated user. 404 if not recorded.
Returns the recorded mood + journal entry for a supplied date (YYYY-MM-DD).
Paginated reverse-chronological list of moods to power the recent moods view.
Allows editing an existing mood entry by ID (change mood type or journal text).
Deletes a mood entry by ID. Useful for “remove journal” flow.
Reads specialists filtered specifically for the Spiritual Hub. Same data as specialist listing but tailored for mindfulness filters (category/location/min_rating).
Lists notifications for the authenticated user. Supports filtering by status/type and pagination.
Returns full payload for a single notification (title, body, metadata).
Marks a notification as read/unread/archived.
Marks every notification for the authenticated user as read.
Soft deletes a single notification for the user (used for swipe-to-dismiss).
Clears all notifications for the user (used for dropdown "Clear All").
Returns the unread count for the badge/dot on the UI.
Admin-only endpoint to create a reusable notification template.
Returns all notification templates (admin dashboard use).
Triggers delivery of a template to all users or a subset of user IDs.

Returns an array of all available article categories. Use this endpoint to populate category dropdowns and filters in the frontend. Categories include: Sleep, Exercise, Meditation, Mood Tracking, Fitness, Yoga. This is a public endpoint and does not require authentication.

response.name: Success 200
response.body:
{
    "success": true,
    "data": [
        "Sleep",
        "Exercise",
        "Meditation",
        "Mood Tracking",
        "Fitness",
        "Yoga",
        "Anxiety",
        "Depression",
        "Stress Management",
        "Self-Care",
        "Relationships",
        "Nutrition",
        "Mindfulness",
        "Therapy & Counseling",
        "Personal Growth",
        "Work-Life Balance",
        "Addiction Recovery",
        "Trauma Healing",
        "Parenting & Family",
        "Grief & Loss",
        "Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT)",
        "Other"
    ]
}

request.description: Specialist-only endpoint. Creates a new article with title, category, content, and optional featured image. Status can be 'draft' or 'published'. If published, the article becomes immediately visible to all users. Read time is automatically calculated based on content length. Returns the created article with _id for subsequent operations.

body.raw:
{
    "title": "Small Victory: I talked to someone today",
    "category": "Meditation",
    "content": "This is a comprehensive article about meditation and mindfulness. It covers various techniques and benefits of regular meditation practice. Meditation has been shown to reduce stress, improve focus, and enhance overall well-being. In this article, we will explore different meditation styles and how to get started with your practice.",
    "featured_image_url": "https://example.com/article-image.jpg",
    "status": "draft"
}

response.name: Success 201

body.raw:
{
    "title": "Small Victory: I talked to someone today",
    "category": "Meditation",
    "content": "This is a comprehensive article about meditation and mindfulness.",
    "featured_image_url": "https://example.com/article-image.jpg",
    "status": "draft"
}

response.body:
{
    "success": true,
    "message": "Article created successfully",
    "data": {
        "_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012345",
        "specialist_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012346",
        "title": "Small Victory: I talked to someone today",
        "category": "Meditation",
        "content": "This is a comprehensive article about meditation and mindfulness.",
        "featured_image_url": "https://example.com/article-image.jpg",
        "status": "draft",
        "published_at": null,
        "views": 0,
        "likes": 0,
        "read_time": 1,
        "created_at": "2025-01-21T10:30:00.000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-21T10:30:00.000Z",
        "specialist": {
            "_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012346",
            "full_name": "Dr. John Smith",
            "designation": "Therapist",
            "profile_photo": "https://example.com/profile.jpg"
        }
    }
}

request.description: Specialist-only endpoint. Returns paginated list of the authenticated specialist's own articles. Use 'status' query parameter to filter by 'draft', 'published', or 'all'. Response includes total count and published_count which can be used to display 'Recently Published (N)' badge. Useful for the article management screen where specialists can see all their articles.

query.description: Number of articles per page (default: 10, max: 50)

response.name: Success 200
response.body:
{
    "success": true,
    "data": [
        {
            "_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012345",
            "specialist_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012346",
            "title": "Understanding Meditation",
            "category": "Meditation",
            "content": "This is a comprehensive article about meditation...",
            "featured_image_url": "https://example.com/image.jpg",
            "status": "published",
            "published_at": "2025-01-20T10:00:00.000Z",
            "views": 150,
            "likes": 25,
            "read_time": 5,
            "created_at": "2025-01-20T09:00:00.000Z",
            "updated_at": "2025-01-20T10:00:00.000Z",
            "specialist": {
                "_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012346",
                "full_name": "Dr. John Smith",
                "designation": "Therapist",
                "profile_photo": "https://example.com/profile.jpg"
            }
        }
    ],
    "pagination": {
        "page": 1,
        "limit": 10,
        "total": 15,
        "totalPages": 2
    },
    "total": 15,
    "published_count": 12
}

request.description: Public endpoint. Returns paginated list of all published articles. Use this for the main article listing screen. Supports filtering by category (use exact category name from Get Categories endpoint) and specialist_id. Articles are sorted by published_at descending (newest first). Response includes author information (name, profile_photo, designation) for display.

query.description: Optional: Filter by category (e.g., 'Meditation', 'Exercise', 'Sleep'). Use 'All Articles' or omit to get all categories.
Optional: Filter articles by specific specialist ID

request.description: Public endpoint. Returns top-rated/most-viewed published articles for the 'Featured Articles' section on the article listing screen. Articles are sorted by views (descending) and then by published_at. Use limit parameter to control how many featured articles to display (default: 6, recommended: 4-6 for mobile UI).

query.description: Number of featured articles to return (default: 6, max: 20)

}

request.description: Public endpoint. Searches published articles by keyword across title and content fields. Returns paginated results with total count. Use this for the search functionality in the article screen. If no results found, returns empty array with count: 0. Response includes 'count' field which can be displayed as 'N Results found' in the UI.

query.description: Search query string (searches in title and content)

request.description: Public endpoint. Returns full article details including complete content, author information, read time, views count, and published date. Use this for the article detail/read screen. View count is automatically incremented on each request. Returns 404 if article doesn't exist or is not published. Response includes full HTML/rich text content for rendering.

variable.description: Article ID from article listing or create response

response.name: Success 200
response.body:
{

    "data": {
        "_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012345",
        "specialist_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012346",

        "content": "This is the full article content with detailed information about meditation practices, benefits, and techniques. It includes comprehensive guidance for beginners and advanced practitioners alike.",

        "status": "published",
        "published_at": "2025-01-21T09:00:00.000Z",

        "likes": 65,

        "updated_at": "2025-01-21T09:00:00.000Z",
        "specialist": {
            "_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012346",
            "full_name": "Dr. John Smith",
            "designation": "Therapist",
            "profile_photo": "https://example.com/profile.jpg"
        }
    }
}

request.description: Specialist-only endpoint. Updates an existing article owned by the authenticated specialist. All fields are optional - only include fields you want to update. If content is updated, read_time_minutes is automatically recalculated. If status is changed to 'published', published_at is automatically set. You can only update your own articles.

body.raw:
{
    "title": "Updated: Small Victory: I talked to someone today",
    "category": "Meditation",
    "content": "This is an updated comprehensive article about meditation and mindfulness. It covers various techniques and benefits of regular meditation practice. Meditation has been shown to reduce stress, improve focus, and enhance overall well-being. In this updated article, we will explore different meditation styles and how to get started with your practice.",
    "featured_image_url": "https://example.com/updated-image.jpg",
    "status": "published"
}

response.name: Success 200
response.body:
{
    "success": true,
    "message": "Article updated successfully",
    "data": {
        "_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012345",
        "specialist_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012346",
        "title": "Updated Article Title",
        "category": "Meditation",
        "content": "Updated content with new information...",
        "featured_image_url": "https://example.com/updated-image.jpg",
        "status": "published",
        "published_at": "2025-01-21T10:00:00.000Z",
        "views": 450,
        "likes": 65,
        "read_time": 8,
        "created_at": "2025-01-20T08:00:00.000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-21T11:00:00.000Z",
        "specialist": {
            "_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012346",
            "full_name": "Dr. John Smith",
            "designation": "Therapist",
            "profile_photo": "https://example.com/profile.jpg"
        }
    }
}

request.description: Specialist-only endpoint. Publishes a draft article, making it visible to all users. Changes status from 'draft' to 'published' and sets published_at timestamp. Returns error if article is already published. Use this when specialist clicks 'Publish Article' button in the article editor screen.

response.name: Success 200

request.description: Specialist-only endpoint. Permanently deletes an article owned by the authenticated specialist. Use with caution as this action cannot be undone. Returns success message on successful deletion. You can only delete your own articles.

response.name: Success 200

request.description: Public endpoint. Returns array of all available forum post categories with post counts. Use this to populate the category filter dropdown in the forum screen. Categories match the article categories (22 total). Response format: [{category: 'Depression', count: 5}, ...]. Use count to show 'N posts' badge next to each category.

response.name: Success 200

request.description: Authenticated endpoint. Creates a new forum post. All users can create posts. Set is_anonymous to true if user wants to post anonymously (author will show as 'Anonymous_user_XXX'). Title must be 3-200 characters, description must be at least 10 characters. Category must be one of the valid categories from Get Categories endpoint. Returns created post with all fields including _id, author name, likes_count (0), comments_count (0), views (0), and timestamps.

response.name: Success 201
response.body:
{
    "success": true,
    "message": "Post created successfully",
    "data": {
        "_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012345",
        "title": "Small Victory: I talked to someone today",
        "description": "I've been struggling with social anxiety for months, but today I managed to have a conversation with a colleague.",
        "category": "Anxiety",
        "is_anonymous": false,
        "author": "John Doe",
        "likes_count": 0,
        "comments_count": 0,
        "views": 0,
        "created_at": "2025-01-21T10:30:00.000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-21T10:30:00.000Z"
    }
}

request.description: Public endpoint. Returns paginated list of all forum posts sorted by newest first (createdAt descending). Use this for the main forum listing screen. Supports filtering by category (use exact category name from Get Categories). Optional Authorization header: if provided, response includes is_liked field for each post showing if the authenticated user liked it. Response includes pagination metadata (page, limit, total, total_pages).

header.description: Optional: JWT token to get is_liked status for each post

query.description: Optional: Filter by category (e.g., 'Depression', 'Anxiety', 'Stress Management'). Omit to get all categories.

response.name: Success 200
response.body:
{
    "success": true,
    "data": [
        {
            "_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012345",
            "title": "Feeling overwhelmed today",
            "description": "I've been feeling really overwhelmed with work and personal life. Does anyone have tips for managing stress?",
            "category": "Depression",
            "is_anonymous": false,
            "author": "Jane Smith",
            "likes_count": 12,
            "comments_count": 5,
            "views": 45,
            "created_at": "2025-01-21T09:00:00.000Z",
            "updated_at": "2025-01-21T09:00:00.000Z"
        }
    ],
    "pagination": {
        "page": 1,
        "limit": 10,
        "total": 15,
        "total_pages": 2
    }
}

request.description: Public endpoint. Returns full details of a single forum post including title, description, category, author (or Anonymous_user_XXX if anonymous), likes_count, comments_count, views, and timestamps. View count is automatically incremented on each request. Optional Authorization header: if provided, response includes is_liked field showing if the authenticated user liked this post. Use this for the post detail screen.

header.description: Optional: JWT token to get is_liked status

response.name: Success 200
response.body:
{
    "success": true,
    "data": {
        "_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012345",
        "title": "Feeling overwhelmed today",
        "description": "I've been feeling really overwhelmed with work and personal life. Does anyone have tips for managing stress?",
        "category": "Depression",
        "is_anonymous": false,
        "author": "Jane Smith",
        "likes_count": 12,
        "comments_count": 5,
        "views": 46,
        "is_liked": true,
        "created_at": "2025-01-21T09:00:00.000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-21T09:00:00.000Z"
    }
}

request.description: Public endpoint. Searches forum posts by keyword across title and description fields. Returns paginated results sorted by newest first. Use this for the search functionality in the forum screen. If query is empty, returns all posts. Response includes pagination metadata and count field showing total matching results.

query.description: Search query string (searches in title and description)

response.name: Success 200
response.body:
{
    "success": true,
    "data": [
        {
            "_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012345",
            "title": "Dealing with anxiety attacks",
            "description": "I've been experiencing anxiety attacks lately and looking for support.",
            "category": "Anxiety",
            "is_anonymous": false,
            "author": "John Doe",
            "likes_count": 8,
            "comments_count": 3,
            "views": 25,
            "created_at": "2025-01-20T14:00:00.000Z",
            "updated_at": "2025-01-20T14:00:00.000Z"
        }
    ],
    "count": 5,
    "pagination": {
        "page": 1,
        "limit": 10,
        "total": 5,
        "total_pages": 1
    }
}

request.description: Authenticated endpoint. Returns paginated list of the authenticated user's own forum posts. Use this for the 'My Posts' screen where users can see and manage their posts. Supports filtering by category. Posts are sorted by newest first. Response includes pagination metadata. Only returns posts created by the authenticated user.

query.description: Optional: Filter by category. Omit to get all user's posts.

response.name: Success 200
response.body:
{
    "success": true,
    "data": [
        {
            "_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012345",
            "title": "My anxiety journey",
            "description": "I wanted to share my experience with anxiety and how I've been managing it.",
            "category": "Anxiety",
            "is_anonymous": false,
            "author": "John Doe",
            "likes_count": 5,
            "comments_count": 2,
            "views": 18,
            "created_at": "2025-01-19T10:00:00.000Z",
            "updated_at": "2025-01-19T10:00:00.000Z"
        }
    ],
    "pagination": {
        "page": 1,
        "limit": 10,
        "total": 3,
        "total_pages": 1
    }
}

request.description: Authenticated endpoint. Updates an existing forum post owned by the authenticated user. All fields are optional - only include fields you want to update. You can only update your own posts (returns 403 if trying to update another user's post). Title must be 3-200 characters if provided, description must be at least 10 characters if provided. Category must be a valid category if provided. Returns updated post with all fields.

response.name: Success 200
response.body:
{
    "success": true,
    "message": "Post updated successfully",
    "data": {
        "_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012345",
        "title": "Updated Post Title",
        "description": "This is an updated description with sufficient content.",
        "category": "Stress Management",
        "is_anonymous": false,
        "author": "John Doe",
        "likes_count": 5,
        "comments_count": 2,
        "views": 18,
        "created_at": "2025-01-19T10:00:00.000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-21T11:00:00.000Z"
    }
}

request.description: Authenticated endpoint. Permanently deletes a forum post owned by the authenticated user. This action also deletes all associated likes and comments (cascade deletion). Use with caution as this action cannot be undone. You can only delete your own posts (returns 403 if trying to delete another user's post). Returns success message on successful deletion.

response.name: Success 200

request.description: Authenticated endpoint. Toggles like status on a forum post. If post is not liked, it will be liked (returns is_liked: true). If post is already liked, it will be unliked (returns is_liked: false). Response includes is_liked boolean and updated likes_count. When a user likes another user's post, a notification is automatically sent to the post author with format: '{username} liked your post'. No notification is sent if user likes their own post.

response.name: Success 200 - Liked
Success 200 - Unliked

request.description: Public endpoint. Returns paginated list of comments for a specific forum post. Comments are sorted by newest first (createdAt descending). Response includes comment content, author (or Anonymous_user_XXX if anonymous), is_anonymous flag, and timestamps. Use this to display comments on the post detail screen. Response includes pagination metadata.

response.name: Success 200

request.description: Authenticated endpoint. Creates a new comment on a forum post. Content must be 1-1000 characters. Set is_anonymous to true if user wants to comment anonymously (author will show as 'Anonymous_user_XXX'). When a user comments on another user's post, a notification is automatically sent to the post author with format: '{username} commented on your post' and body: '{username}: "{comment preview}"'. No notification is sent if user comments on their own post. Comment count on the post is automatically incremented.

variable.description: Forum post ID to comment on

response.name: Success 201

request.description: Authenticated endpoint. Updates an existing comment owned by the authenticated user. Only content field can be updated. Content must be 1-1000 characters if provided. You can only update your own comments (returns 403 if trying to update another user's comment). Returns updated comment with all fields including author name and timestamps.

response.name: Success 200

request.description: Authenticated endpoint. Permanently deletes a comment owned by the authenticated user. Comment count on the post is automatically decremented. You can only delete your own comments (returns 403 if trying to delete another user's comment). Returns success message on successful deletion.

response.name: Success 200

request.description: Authenticated endpoint. Creates a new journal entry for a specific date, or updates an existing entry if one already exists for that date. Date must be in YYYY-MM-DD format. Content is required (1-10000 characters). Mood is optional (happy, sad, anxious, tired, angry, calm, neutral). If an entry already exists for the date, it will be updated instead of creating a duplicate. Use this when user clicks 'Save Today's Entry' button in the Journal Write screen.

response.name: Success 201

request.description: Authenticated endpoint. Returns today's journal entry if it exists, or null if no entry has been created for today. Use this to populate the 'Today's Journal' section in the Journal screen. If data is null, show the empty state with 'Tap Write to add a private journal entry' message.

response.name: Success 200 - With Entry
Success 200 - No Entry

request.description: Authenticated endpoint. Returns journal entry for a specific date in YYYY-MM-DD format. Use this when user selects a date from the calendar in the Journal screen. Returns null if no entry exists for that date. Date parameter must be in YYYY-MM-DD format (e.g., 2025-09-05).

response.name: Success 200

request.description: Authenticated endpoint. Returns paginated list of previous journal entries, sorted by date descending (newest first). Use this to populate the 'Previous Entries' section in the Journal screen. Each entry includes date, content, mood, and timestamps. Response includes pagination metadata. Entries are displayed with mood icons (happy face, sad face, etc.) based on the mood field.

query.description: Number of entries per page (default: 10, max: 100)

response.name: Success 200

request.description: Authenticated endpoint. Returns all journal entries for a specific month. Use this to populate the calendar view in the Journal screen, showing which dates have entries. Year and month are query parameters (month: 1-12). If not provided, defaults to current year and month. Response includes count of entries for the month.

response.name: Success 200

request.description: Authenticated endpoint. Returns a specific journal entry by its ID. Use this to retrieve full details of a journal entry. Only the entry owner can access their own entries. Returns 404 if entry not found or 403 if trying to access another user's entry.

response.name: Success 200

request.description: Authenticated endpoint. Updates an existing journal entry by ID. Only the entry owner can update their entries. Content and mood are optional - only include fields you want to update. Content must be 1-10000 characters if provided. Returns the updated entry.

response.name: Success 200

request.description: Authenticated endpoint. Permanently deletes a journal entry by ID. Only the entry owner can delete their entries. Use with caution as this action cannot be undone. Returns success message on successful deletion.

response.name: Success 200

request.description:
Fetches the most recently unlocked achievements for the authenticated user. This endpoint is typically used in the Profile Overview tab to show the user's latest accomplishments. Returns an array of achievements sorted by `unlocked_at` date (most recent first). Only includes achievements with status `unlocked` or `claimed`.

**Use Cases:**
- Display recent achievements in user profile
- Show latest accomplishments after unlocking
- Profile overview dashboard

**Query Parameters:**
- `limit` (optional): Number of recent achievements to return (default: 2, max: recommended 10)

query.description: Number of recent achievements to return (default: 2)

response.name: Success - Recent Achievements
Success - No Achievements

request.description:
Fetches all available achievements with the user's progress for each one. This endpoint is used in the Achievements tab to show all achievements, their progress, and status. Returns 38 total achievements across 6 categories: Streak, Community, Activity (Steps, Mood, Journal), and Milestone.

**Use Cases:**
- Display all achievements in Achievements tab
- Show progress bars for each achievement
- Filter achievements by status
- Calculate completion percentage
- Show achievement categories

**Query Parameters:**
- `status` (optional): Filter by status
  - `all`: Returns all achievements (default)
  - `locked`: Only locked achievements
  - `in_progress`: Only achievements in progress
  - `unlocked`: Only unlocked achievements
  - `claimed`: Only claimed achievements

**Response Structure:**
- `total_achievements`: Total number of available achievements (38)
- `unlocked_count`: Number of unlocked/claimed achievements
- `achievements`: Array of all achievements with progress information
  - Each achievement includes: id, name, description, icon, category, status, progress (current/target/percentage), unlocked_at, claimed_at, xp_reward

query.description: Filter by status: all, locked, in_progress, unlocked, claimed

response.name: Success 200
response.body:

request.description:
Claims an unlocked achievement. This marks the achievement as 'claimed' and records the claim timestamp. Users can claim achievements to receive XP rewards and mark them as completed. The achievement status changes from 'unlocked' to 'claimed'.

**Use Cases:**
- User clicks 'Claim' button on unlocked achievement
- Mark achievement as claimed after viewing
- Award XP to user (if XP system is implemented)

**Path Parameters:**
- `id`: The achievement ID (MongoDB ObjectId) to claim. Use the achievement_id from Get All Achievements response.

**Requirements:**
- Achievement must be in `unlocked` status
- Achievement must belong to the authenticated user
- Achievement must exist in the database

response.name: Success 200
Error 404 - Not Unlocked
Error 404 - Not Found

variable.description: Article ID for testing article endpoints
Forum post ID for testing forum endpoints
Comment ID for testing comment endpoints
Journal entry ID for testing journal endpoints
Achievement ID for testing achievement endpoints
